long_desc.thetext:
Hi, About 2 years ago I asked to update acronyms and acronyms.comp for tool: wtf - translates acronyms for you .
Now [1] we have 16 new updates since then, so I though that is a good time to update it again, please.
Thanks,
[1] < $NetBSD: acronyms,v 1.221 2013/09/28 17:58:53 dholland Exp $ --- > $NetBSD: acronyms,v 1.237 2015/05/18 11:56:20 pooka Exp $

Hi, after some digging I found [1]
we also got update on wtf script may we should use wtf-20150518.tar.gz, from sf.net because now we got 4 acronyms files: - acronyms - acronyms.comp - acronyms-o.fake - acronyms-o.real
[1] http://bsdwtf.sourceforge.net/

This message is a reminder that Fedora 21 is nearing its end of life. Approximately 4 (four) weeks from now Fedora will stop maintaining and issuing updates for Fedora 21. It is Fedora's policy to close all bug reports from releases that are no longer maintained. At that time this bug will be closed as EOL if it remains open with a Fedora 'version' of '21'.
Package Maintainer: If you wish for this bug to remain open because you plan to fix it in a currently maintained version, simply change the 'version' to a later Fedora version.
Thank you for reporting this issue and we are sorry that we were not able to fix it before Fedora 21 is end of life. If you would still like to see this bug fixed and are able to reproduce it against a later version of Fedora, you are encouraged change the 'version' to a later Fedora version prior this bug is closed as described in the policy above.
Although we aim to fix as many bugs as possible during every release's lifetime, sometimes those efforts are overtaken by events. Often a more recent Fedora release includes newer upstream software that fixes bugs or makes them obsolete.

(In reply to Sergio Monteiro Basto from comment #1) > Hi, after some digging I found [1] > > we also got update on wtf script may we should use wtf-20150518.tar.gz, from > sf.net because now we got 4 acronyms files: > - acronyms > - acronyms.comp > - acronyms-o.fake > - acronyms-o.real > > [1] http://bsdwtf.sourceforge.net/
I tried update all bsd-games from freebsd, but last rebase have 10 years and will give me lot of work, which I think not worth it and I don't have much time either. So maybe just keep wtf updated is a better solution so what about split wtf from the rest of bsd-games and do a separated package ? the bsdwtf package.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase

I'm request commit access , I'd like split wtf from bsd-games , and do a new package bsd-wtf with http://bsdwtf.sourceforge.net/ source .
Thanks.
bsd-games-2.17-51.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-b2daf75908
bsd-games-2.17-51.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-dd7af6eb98
bsd-games-2.17-51 includes the latest acronyms files. If you do create a new package for wtf we can change bsd-games to simply not build its version.

(In reply to Jeff Makey from comment #8) > bsd-games-2.17-51 includes the latest acronyms files. If you do create a > new package for wtf we can change bsd-games to simply not build its version.
Thank you for update this, I will just make a quick reply because I'm very busy right now . I will check wtf , I think we need update the wtf script to use also acronyms-o.real, I will check it later soon. I think, I will prefer maintain wtf in bsd-games package because we will have less work .

bsd-games-2.17-51.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-dd7af6eb98

bsd-games-2.17-51.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-b2daf75908
bsd-games-2.17-51.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
bsd-games-2.17-51.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
